p: It is reported that the Seadornaviruses could be carried by a variety of blood-sucking insects including mosquitoes, ticks, and midges and even have been isolated from pigs, cattle and patients with fever and encephalitis [ 4â€“ 10]. Studies have also shown that BAV, which is the prototype of genus Seadornavirus, is an emerging pathogen that causes human viral encephalitis [ 2]. Therefore, Seadornaviruses may well be a group of newly discovered viruses close related to human and animal diseases [ 2, 4].
